In ancient Egyptian culture, water is closely tied to the cycle of life and death, symbolized by the annual flooding of the Nile River, which was considered sacred and associated with the god Osiris, representing rebirth and resurrection. In Japanese culture, water in traditions such as tea ceremonies (sado) represents purification and contemplation, reflecting the concept of "wabi-sabi." Water features like waterfalls and ponds in Japanese gardens embody flow and renewal.
